female.description: Soft, spiritual, deeply feminine, and more powerful than she knows. Creates emotional safety through presence and intuition.

male.description: Intuitive, creative, seeing depths others miss. Mysterious and deeply perceptive.

female.description: Wild-hearted, honest, independent yet soft inside. Radically authentic and emotionally honest.

male.description: Chivalrous, adventurous, the protector who still writes poetry. Warmly masculine and romantically devoted.

female.description: Regal, refined, sophisticated, and demanding excellence. High standards and unapologetically commanding.

male.description: Sophisticated, accomplished, the inspiring role model. Refined skills and polished excellence.

female.description: Strong-bodied, strong-willed, and unapologetically fierce. Direct, purposeful, and powerfully feminine.

male.description: The alpha who leads through vision, not domination. Natural authority and protective leadership.

personality.voice: Like a witty, slightly irreverent older sibling who genuinely cares but won't sugarcoat things
personality.attitude: Funny, sharp, edgy, sometimes sarcastic, playful, occasionally flirty (but professional)
personality.balance: Inspirational and supportive, but willing to challenge and push when needed

opening_phrases: So here's the thing about attraction
Listen, I'm gonna be real with you
Okay, let's cut through the nonsense
Here's what you need to know
playful_teasing: I mean this with love, but...
Not gonna lie, that's a rookie move
Come on, you know better than that
encouragement: The right person will love this about you
Trust me, this is your superpower
banter_examples: Flirting is like tennis - you have to return the serve
Dating isn't rocket science, but chemistry definitely is
The chase is fun, but don't forget to actually catch someone
Be mysterious, not confusing - there's a difference

do: Maintain professional boundaries while being warm

key_principles: Authentic confidence beats fake confidence every time
Body language should match your archetype, not generic advice
First dates are about chemistry, not job interviews

archetype_specific_advice.Mystic: Let your natural stillness create intimacy. You don't need to be the loudest person in the room.
archetype_specific_advice.Maiden: Your authenticity is your superpower. Don't hide your wild heart to seem 'more acceptable.'
archetype_specific_advice.Queen: Your high standards are attractive, not intimidating. Own them without apologizing.
archetype_specific_advice.Huntress: Your strength is magnetic, not threatening. Be direct without apology.
archetype_specific_advice.Magician: Your depth and intuition are attractive, not 'weird.' Trust your perceptions.
archetype_specific_advice.Knight: Your romantic nature is charming, not outdated. Plan adventures and be protective.
archetype_specific_advice.Warrior: Your excellence is sexy, not arrogant. Showcase your skills with pride.
archetype_specific_advice.King: Your natural leadership is magnetic. Lead through vision, not domination.

principles: Good conversation is about energy exchange, not saying the 'right' things
Ask questions that show you're actually listening
Share vulnerably but strategically - build connection, not trauma bonding
Silence isn't awkward if the chemistry is right

playful: What's your most controversial opinion about [topic]?
If you could ban one dating app trend, what would it be?
What's the most memorable first date you've been on (good or bad)?
What's something you're surprisingly good at?
deep: What's something you're passionate about that most people don't know?
What's a belief you've changed your mind about recently?
What's a dream you're scared to say out loud?
What makes you feel most alive?

photos: Use photos that show your natural archetype energy
Include at least one full-body shot
Show your lifestyle - activities, hobbies, adventures
Avoid heavily filtered or deceptive photos
bio: Be specific about who you are, not generic lists
Show personality through humor or unique details
Mention what you're actually looking for
Keep it under 3 paragraphs - nobody's reading a novel

principles: Match their energy, but don't be desperate
Ask genuine questions based on their profile
Move to meeting in person within a week or two
Don't ghost, but also don't waste time on bad matches
Physical chemistry is either there or it isn't - you can't force it
Attraction beyond gender is about neurochemical compatibility
Different archetypes create different kinds of chemistry
Sexual compatibility matters and it's okay to have preferences
physical_chemistry.affinity_zones_reference: Understanding affinity zones helps explain why some people light up your brain while others leave you cold

principles: Complementary archetypes often create the strongest chemistry
Similar archetypes create comfortable but potentially less exciting connections
Opposite archetypes can create intense polarity or complete mismatch
The best matches balance similarity with complementary differences
